definition: painted skin (which transforms a monster into a beauty)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi

sentences.english: "Painted Skin" is adapted from the ancient novel "Liaozhai Zhiyi", or "Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio", written by Pu Songling in the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《畫皮》取材於清代蒲松齡的古代小說《聊齋志異》。

sentences.english: It is time to leave the theater and see China for what it is.
sentences.chinese: 是時候揭開紙老虎的畫皮，直視中國的真實面目。

sentences.english: She ripped off the mask of the hypocrite mercilessly.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不留情地剝掉這個僞君子的畫皮。

sentences.english: Once more, "Evildoer's disguise" itself has not interchangeability.
sentences.chinese: 再次，《畫皮》本身所具有的不可替代性。

sentences.english: The movie claims to be a sequel to the previous hit Painted Skin.
sentences.chinese: 《畫壁》號稱是上一部大熱影片《畫皮》的續集。

definition: to play a small role
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
contemporary drama
romance film
to shave the whole head clean/crushing defeat
harmony is to be prized
Tale of the White Snake/Madame White Snake
golden branch, jade leaves (idiom); fig. blue-blooded nobility, esp. imperial kinsmen or peerless beauty
facial nerve paralysis
Curse of the Golden Flower (2007), period drama movie by Zhang Yimou
pinyin: Man3 cheng2 jin4 dai4 huang2 jin1 jia3

definition: to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
verbal sparring/duel of words
to fight and scheme against each other (idiom)/(in palace construction) elaborate and refined
lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person
scheming/shrewdness
